column2: Fedup, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I took Feldene for roughly 10 years; first prescribed for an "all-over" pain, undiagnosed, but presumed (by the quack dr.) to be issues with the sheaths over tendons. When the FDA(?) pulled it, I was prescribed something else and decided to just see how things go. Much to my surprise and relief, the debilitating charlie horse cramps all over my body (preventing me from driving, no less, and many other things such as dancing and exercising) quickly disappeared! Why couldn't any of my doctors figure out it was the Feldene causing the charlie horses? I suffer a lot of pain from spine stenosis, fibromayalgia, arthritis, and am on two other pain meds: Vicodine and Flexril. Now I'm afraid that these meds are actually causing more pain and damage than good.

column9: I have bursitis in my hip and the doctors all but had written me off and said there was nothing they could do for my pain after the cortisone injections did not work.My orthopedic dr. prescribed this to me and it worked! I am not one to take narcotics and have taken many anti-inflammatory pills which did nothing. I was so glad this actually took my pain away. I was drowsy for a few days when I took it but did at night anyway. Now I can take it during the day and it doesnt make me drowsy at all. I can also get this at Walmart for $4. I have had no stomach problems from it, and my stomach is quite sensitive. I would recommend it to at least try it for your pain.
